hackathon-description-text: Squirrel Hacks 2018 is a hackathon that Earlham Hackers club is organizing for March 3rd and 4th. The hackathon will be hosted on the Earlham College campus. We hope to bring creative minds from colleges of the Richmond area and beyond.
hackathon-eligibility: Participants must be at least 18 years of age. Teams can have at most 4 people.
hackathon-requirements: Projects must be submitted before 11:00 AM on Sunday (March 4th) to be eligible for judging and awards.
hackathon-rules:
Hackers are not allowed to work on their projects before SquirrelHacks official hacking period. You are, however, allowed to come up with ideas, plan, and prepare! Also, everyone is required to follow the 
https://hackcodeofconduct.org/

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The team with the best Social Justice project will win up to four Raspberry Pie 3 Complete Starter Kit
The team with the best Public Health-related hack will win up to four 500mAh solar charger power banks

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=801 National Rd W, Richmond, IN 47374, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
What's your project's "wow" factor? How did you go above and beyond?
1 - 10

How much did the participants learn from the project? Did they have to overcome any challenges? What risks did they take?
1 - 10

hackathon-location-address: 801 National Rd W, Richmond, IN 47374, USA
hackathon-description-header: Earlham College's inaugural hackathon. Work on innovative projects to solve different issues in Social Justice or Global Health
